Lucas Filz wrote:

> Dear JUnit developers!
>
> Reading so much about classloading problems, I'd like to suggest for JU3.6
> (or is that already on its way?)
>
>
> 2. Eliminating problems related to IDE's. E.g. debugging testcode in
> JBuilder4.
> (Does not stop on breakpoints.) (Again, a classloading problem??)
>

I had the same problem with JBuilder and someone indicated that I needed to
go under the Project Properties menu and select the "Run" tab. Under that
tab, add  "-classic" to the VM parameters field.

When I ran the IDE debugger, I could then stop on breakpoints properly.
(Actually, the problem I had was that I could set a breakpoint and it would
stop at the breakpoint, but only once. If the breakpoint was in a loop or
function that was called again, it wouldn't stop the second time through).

Hope that helps you too...
